Translated_Text: The boys gave books to each otherr.
The boys hit each other (in a fight).
The child keeps his eyes shut.
The children put each other on the sledge while playing.
The woman let the child fall \dropped the child.
The old man's friend died on him. \The friend died; the old man is negatively afected.
Comment: Here the reflexive-posssessive form gia-j is in the direct object position.

Translated_Text: The man coughs.
Comment: The resultative form has multiplicative (pluractional) meaning with some verbs, including this one.

Translated_Text: The children carried each other (while playing).
The woman sings.
The reindeer is tied.
The woman filled the cup with milk.
The bear frightened the child.
You think about me?
The bear smelled the man.
The woman hugged her child.
The child fell.
My father is a hunter.
The ground is dry.
The forest is burning.
The boat sank.
The stone rolled.
The child is sad.
The child plays.
The girl screamed.
The girl laughed.
The child went home.
The child sat on the ground.
The child blinked.
The woman carried the child home.
The old man hid the money (from his friend).
The boy peeled the potatoes.
The neighbor took a reindeer from me.
The old man beats the boy with the stick.
The man built the house from wood.
The woman shouted at the child.
The dog followed me.
The woman helped the child.
The woman cut her hair.
The friends talked.
Comment: The same form can also be used (even if rarely) with an object like ad'it-u 'truth'. In both cases the reciprocal form marks cross-coreferentiality with the indirect (allative) object-addressee.

Translated_Text: The man met with a friend.
Comment: Here the meaning MEET is rendered by a lexicalized sociative form of bak- 'find'; the same form allows both a transitive and a comitative intransitive pattern.

Translated_Text: The child washed (himself).
The child is afraid of the dog.
The children are afraid of each other.
Comment: The so-called indirect reciprocal, which marks cross-coreferentiality with an oblique (instrumental) object.

Translated_Text: The children washed each other.
The meat doesn’t cut (easily).
Comment: When formed from verbs which do not focus on the change-of-state, and in appropriate context (e.g. negative or with an adverb), the mediopassive form has a potential (Levin's "middle") rather than anticausative interpretation.

Translated_Text: The reindeer is tied to the tree.
The man was / got killed.
Comment: This form can also have (exceptionally) a (auto-)reflexive meaning ('hurt oneself').

Translated_Text: The water was poured (into the cup).
The old man is caught by the rain.
The old man was killed by the bear.
The boy wiped the dirt from the cloth.
The woman washed the child.
The boy touched the snake with the stick.
The man tied the reindeer to the tree.
The man threw the food into the fire.
The man told a story to the boy.
Comment: Instead of gön- also ukčen- can be used for 'tell'.

Translated_Text: The boy tore the page from the book.
The man talked to the boy about him.
The boy stole the book from the teacher.
The man sat down (on the ground).
The man sat on the ground.
The boy sang (a song).
Comment: The cognate object is optional.

Translated_Text: The boy showed the book to the teacher.
The man shouted to/at the boy.
The teacher sent the boy to school.
The man saw the boy.
The man said the truth to the boy.
The child ran on the plain.
The man remembered the boy.
It rains.
Comment: Expression of the cognate subject is optional.

Translated_Text: The woman put the child into the cradle.
The girl poured the water into the bowl.
The man met the girl.
The man married the girl.
The woman looked for the child.
The man loaded the child on the sledge.
The boy lived in the village.
Comment: Instead of the verb bi 'to be', a more specific verb menevd'en- 'reside' can also be used.

Translated_Text: The girl liked/loved the boy.
The boy went (from the village).
The man knew the boy.
The boy killed the snake with the stick.
The child jumped on the bed.
Comment: In this construction the noun in the locative case can be also interpreted as goal of motion.

Translated_Text: My head hurts. / I have a headache.
The man hunted for deer.
The boy hit the fox with the stick.
The man ate the bread.
The woman dressed/put on clothes.
The woman dressed the child.
The old man died.
The boy cut the bread with the knife.
The man covered the child with the blanket.
The man coughed.
The boy came (to the village).
The man climbed (up) the mountain.
The man called the boy a fool.
The man built the house.
The boy brought the book to the neighbor.
The boy broke my arm with the stick.
The boy gave the book to the teacher.
The man looked at the boy.
The child is hungry.
The child froze.
The boy asked the man for money.
Comment: The C argument ('what is asked for) is expressed by the embedded converbial clauses based on 'give' (lit. asked to give money).

Translated_Text: There appeared a seal.
He teaches mathematics.
She asked me for money.
The king was not dressed.

Comment: This is the passivized version of a sentence such as ‘the robbers tied the king to a tree with a rope’, but since the Instrumental position in the derived coding frame is "occupied" by the agent (the tier), the instrument (the rope) cannot appear here.
Original_Orthography: Король был привязан разбойниками к дереву.

Translated_Text: Every morning the canister is filled with water.
Comment: This is a passivized version of a sentence like ‘every morning the worker fills the canister with water’. The filler cannot appear in the Instrumental case here because this position is already taken by the filling material.

Translated_Text: Lit. She was thinking a sad thought.

He has a good life here. (lit. it lives well to him).
I remembered this melody.
Comment: Lit. ‘The melody remembered (itself) to me.’ The reflexive suffix creates the anticausative reading.

Comment: ujti ‘leave’ is derived from idti ‘go/walk’ and therefore isn’t applicable to events of leaving by a vehicle. In such cases, uexat' ‘drive/ride away’ is used instead
Original_Orthography: В прошлом году он уехал из города.

Comment: goret' ‘burn’ has the reading ‘be alight’ here

Translated_Text: The house was on fire.

The tree fell onto the fence.

Original_Orthography: Он ушёл из дома в пять утра.

Translated_Text: He tied (around) the tree with the rope.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: You can grind my acorns with that.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They ground acorns with a file.
Comment: with the coarse side of the file, otherwise it'd be waǧo
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I ground my medicine for myself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Grind Heena’s acorns over the sink.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The boys ground acorns over the sink for each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you grind your acorns over the sink?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you grind all the acorns into that bowl for yourself?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I ground my acorns into that bowl.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Grind my acorns into that bowl!
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Grind the acorns into that bowl!
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They are grinding acorns up for each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Have you ground acorns for your self yet?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Have you ground up all your acorns?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: You can grind my acorns by the sink.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: You can grind the acorns over the sink.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Can you grind my acorns for me?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They told you to grind up the acorns have you ground them already?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinųga biik šgaac ceekhižą gigųsirera, haji žee (kara)šgac roogųže ee.
Translated_Text: They taught Hinu a new card game, and then she wanted to play that game here/ her new game, she said she wanted to play that here.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧį rušgap yaakiicgawira Kųnųga wiirojį sgįįgre hižą hirojį hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I made Kunu hit with a heavy bat in baseball practice.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wakąižą yaa'era nąąkawanųnįge nąąksik žiipįk hižą hanįajera hirojį hakį.
Translated_Text: I found a snake and I was afraid, but I made myself beat it with the short stick I had.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I scared out this little rabbit in front of me and made myself throw a stone at it/ hit it with a stone.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wa'į hižą higišik hakąnąkwira, nee (hi)rojį hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: The blanket we hung up they let me beat it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I accidentally beat myself with this stick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They used spears to dance with and they beat each other with them.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They played by the beach and threw mud at each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Teega was naughty so they beat him with ash wood.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you beat my snake with a stick?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I stood there and beat the snake with a stick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Why did you hit me with that stick?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wažąra hižą yaakarašišikjįra, hanį jii hakį.
Translated_Text: Something I really cherished, I brought it here with difficulty.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you bring your computer with you today?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I came here and brought along my computer.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wa'ųregi haki'ųra, rook hožu haakikaranį haji.
Translated_Text: When I made my lunch I brought pie for myself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I brought the pie for myself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinųpike rook hožu haki(ki)nį hajiire, hikinų.
Translated_Text: These two brought pies for each other accidentally.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga nąąpak rook hožu hižą hanį jii haa.
Translated_Text: I had Kunu bring a cherry pie.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Rook hožura nee waanį jii hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: They made me bring the pies.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waagax hižą neexjį haki'ų, nee jii hakaragi waa'ų.
Translated_Text: I sent myself a letter.
Comment: waagax hižą neexjį haki'ų, nee huu/ree/jii hakaragi waa'ų
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made a house with boards.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made a house.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Xatapeja caa t'eekjį hižą yaa'era, t'eekjį wa'ųąknųnįge, horupąną hakį.
Translated_Text: I found a rotting deer in the woods, it was really rotten but I smelled it anyway.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga nąga Heenąga wagujera woo(ku)rupąną warakaragi?
Translated_Text: Did you you have Kunu and Heena smell their shoes?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The new perfume they were selling, did they make you smell it?
Comment: wažą kixų = perfume
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They had me smell the red flowers they brought home.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Kunu he want to take a bath, he must have smelled himself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Šųųkra ceek hakijairegi, higųąną hokikirupąną wa'ųnąąkšąną.
Translated_Text: When dogs first see each other they sniff each other up right away.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: You stepped on manure, do you smell yourself now?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The old shoes I put in the other room, I can smell still them.
Comment: other room= ciisaanįkeja
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The dog is sniffing my feet.
Comment: razįk is slang for 'sniff'
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When all the meat rotted, I smelled it right away.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The bear couldn't see the boy yet, but he smelled it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wijukra s'ii xawanį nųnįge nąąguakeja žige, giwąą hakį.
Translated_Text: The cat was gone for a long time so I made myself holler for it again in the road.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga wijuk hokaranįjeera, ciinąąkeeja giwą rakaragi.
Translated_Text: Kunu is looking for his cat, did you have him holler for it in the back of the house.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They were playing with can phones and they hollered at each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Are you hollering for your cats?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They hollered for him with that microphone.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The had me holler for the kids.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When you hollered for me, I heard you right away.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I've been hollering for you for a while, did you finally just hear me?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: You told me to get dressed so I am getting dressed.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you get your cat dressed?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did your parents dress you (e.g. at the powwow)?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Howaža hocieja hamįkra, hąįnįxjįįk hikikoroho hįgigiire, hąąpokahi.
Translated_Text: When I was in the hospital they dressed me every morning.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: She's getting dressed/ she's getting ready.
Comment:
hikikorohojee = he is getting dressed
hikoroho kįįjee = he is dressing himself
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you all get dressed already?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When they were trying to teach you the new dance, did you have to make yourself jump?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When you were teaching your Hinu the new dance did you make her jump?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waši ceek nįgigųs nąą'įirera, t'ąąt'ąp nįįre?
Translated_Text: When they were teaching you the new dance did they make you jump?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Ciinąąke hiieja paacižą mįįnąkra, hąįnįxjį že'e caa honį hokarat'ąpšąną.
Translated_Text: The back of his house he had a patch of woods there and early this morning he jumped into there to do his deer hunting.
Comment: hii, haa, raa fine with house
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you jump into all my strawberry fields?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you jump into all the strawberry fields already (meaning did you start using all of them)?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you jump into the back of the truck?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The toy they bought him, he is jumping with it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nįįkųųhą ho'ų yaakiicgawira, nįį aakeja haǧep hakį.
Translated_Text: When we were practicing scuba diving I made myself appear on the other side.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nįįkųųhą ho'ų hikiicgara, (nįį) aakejašąną haǧep nįgigiire?
Translated_Text: In your scuba training, did you have you surface only across the river?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: My red roses came up in the back yard, I made them come up in the back yard.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wiišgac'ųeja wanoicge gicąra, Kųnųga hikinų xetexjįra harucap hakaragi.
Translated_Text: At the carnival in picking prizes, I accidentally had my Kunu pick the biggest one.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wooki'ųeja wažą woogairera, woomąnų ha'ųanąga, harucap hakį.
Translated_Text: The prized they were offering at the casino, I cheated and I made myself receive the prize.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hiraati š'aak hiwašjekirera, nee harucap hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: The old car that they all rejected, they let me receive it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: At Christmas when they exchanged names, they were drawing each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I grabbed a red apple for myself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The prize you donated at gaming, did you receive them yourself?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The bingo packet that you were to get, I received it instead.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They selected his number, in the casino/raffle.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: At the casino they gave away tools, I got them.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wakąja hirokerera yaaki'ora, coowe taa'e hakįną.
Translated_Text: When I touched that electrical line, I almost got myself lit up.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I finally got my fire to burn/ with difficulty I started my fire.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He lit it with whisky.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: All my cars burned.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga hišjasura mąąkax hojinąkra, gip'ip'is hakaragi.
Translated_Text: When my Kunu got dust into his eyes I made him blink.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When you got dirt into your eyes, did you make yourself blink?
Comment:
mąąkax could also mean mud
mąącušišik = dirt, dust
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąąkąanįra hišjasuregi mąąką woigiruxųanąga gip'ip'is wįį.
Translated_Text: They put eye drops in my eye and made me blink.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Naaghi is blinking his eyes.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧįra parasrairera, Kųnųga hižą ruus rakaragi?
Translated_Text: The flat balls, did you have your Kunu take one?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kšeera hanąąc t'eek harairera, hižą ruus rakį?
Translated_Text: The apples were starting to rot, did you make yourself take one/ did you take one anyway?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Biik šgaacra, kųųhąija hižą ruus nįįre?
Translated_Text: Did they make you draw a card from the bottom when playing cards?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wooruwį hocieja, wainį hikikisge hikinų kikirusireže aanąąkšąną.
Translated_Text: They selected the same clothes for each other at the store.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hiraatihižą kiiruwįra žuura hųųgiinącra, žee ee hi(ki)rus wa'ų.
Translated_Text: He bought himself a car with the money he borrowed from me.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga waagaxhaja reekjenera, iihįra gik'o hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I had my Kunu shave his beard cause he was going to school.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I dipped my beard in the soup and I made myself shave it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąąnąąpeeja hahiregi higųąną, iihįra gik'o wįįre.
Translated_Text: When I joined the military, right away they made me shave my beard.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you shave off your beard/mustache?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I shaved myself with dull knife this morning.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nįįkjąkra šįįǧopra hanąąc ee waicop warakaragi?
Translated_Text: Did you have your kids chop the onions?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They chopped up the onions for each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you chop up the onions for yourself?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hikiware wooruceja nįįkjąįkra waamįnąk hąąkšieja mįįnąk karakąnąknąąkšąną.
Translated_Text: In the restaurant they placed their kids in a highchair.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waagaxhajahocieja woorak hokarakirekjeesgera, hocįcįįkra ee warakaragi?
Translated_Text: When they were to tell their story at school, did you make your boys say it?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Xeeeja rašgac rahiwira, xee harukąnąk hocįcįra howanąną warakaragi?
Translated_Text: When you went to play by the hill, did you let your boys roll (down)?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wažą paa giririx hašjawira, hocįcįįkra hiki'o warakaragi?
Translated_Text: When you saw elephants did you let your kids touch it?
Comment: ....wiiki'o warakaragi? several elephants
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąą'e hajaireže airera, hocįcįra ciikųųhąija nųųxąwą warakaragi?
Translated_Text: When they said a tornado was coming did you make your boys hide in the basement?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąą'e hajaireže airera, ciikųųhąija nųųxąwą hakį.
Translated_Text: They said that a tornado was seen, so I made myself hide in the basement.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąą'e hajaireže airera, cii kųųhąija nųųxąwą hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: They said that a tornado was seen, so they let me hide in their basement.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Ciieja hisge horaje hajiirera, wijukra nųų(ki)xąwą hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: When we had visitors at our house, they made my cat hide.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He hid it for him with something.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Xąąwį hakiruką, nųųxąwą wagigųsirera, žee heesge hinųxąwą wa'ų.
Translated_Text: They taught them to camouflage with grass, that's what he used to hide with.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He hid himself well, and they were unable to find him.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Jaanįk hiraati hirawahas harukosirera, s'ii hanųkixąwą nįhe.
Translated_Text: The fact that he was arrested for drunk driving, he kept it a secret for a long time.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: That car he demolished, he kept it (his) hidden for a long time, he kept it his secret for a long time.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I'm going to keep it a secret from Kunu that I took his toy.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Eegi haji hicąwį hiira nųųgixąwą wa'ųnąkšąną.
Translated_Text: He came here to hide from his wife.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kšee nąąhižą nąąwacak sanįkeja jeera, hocįcįra hahi kšee wamąąnų warakaragi?
Translated_Text: Did you let your boys steal apples from the other side of the fence?
Comment: Kšee nąąhižą/nąąkšee nąąwacak sanįkeja jeera, hoįcįra hahi kšee wamąąnų warakaragi?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Iinįxete sgįįgreižą hatucapwira, Kųnųga ee ųųrehi hakaragi.
Translated_Text: We picked up a heavy rock, and I made my Kunu throw it. (e.g. when clearing up a field).
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hoo haisik hahira, hoošušucižą haisikra, hanįkere peewįxjįnųnįge, horoǧocra xųnųįk gejenį, eesge haakja ųųrehi hakį.
Translated_Text: I went fishing, I caught a trout, but because it looked kind of small, I made myself throw it back.
Comment: OR: haakja nįįeja waat'ųtee
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąąs howaǧuk šgaaceja nee hiraakjį ųųreehi nįįre?
Translated_Text: At the horseshoe game did they make you throw last?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They threw strawberries into each other's bowls.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Kunu threw a strawberry into his bowl. / He threw his strawberry into the bowl.
Comment: hokarat'ųre would be more proper
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Heena threw a strawberry into Kunu’s bowl.
Comment: hogit'ųre would sound better
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Heenąga Kųnųga wanįkhiicge hanįra cuugi higi'ųrehi.
Translated_Text: Heena threw Kunu's egg using a spoon.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Heena used a spoon and threw his egg with it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Ciinąkeja hahi jeega, hiraaticekra hikara'ų (rehii) wa'ų.
Translated_Text: He, who is in town, he used the new car that's how he got there quickly.
Comment: different verb
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They threw that rock with a sling.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I threw my log in the back of the truck.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He threw the log onto the truck himself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you throw my ball? (away from me)?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The strips of ash wood you've left outside, did you have your relatives cover them?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Siikąra nąąkjų nųnįge, hirasa šgaac hakį.
Translated_Text: Even though I had twisted my ankle I made myself play also.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nįįkjąk xųnųįkra waǧįǧį nąąxjak šgaacnąąkra, Kųnųga (hire)anąga Heenąga šgaac warakaragi?
Translated_Text: When they were playing soccer, did you have your Kunu and Heena play?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧį rušgap šgaacirera, hopažanųnįge hirasa šgaac wįįre.
Translated_Text: They were playing baseball and even though I was sick they also made my play.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧį rušgap hašgacwira horušjąija hahi šgaac hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: We played baseball, they let me play at the end.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waagaxhajahocieja, hegų jaagu šgaacirera, Kųnųga hanąąc wašgac ruxuruk wa'ųjee.
Translated_Text: What they play at school, whatever, Kunu can play them all.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Hinu and Kunu played with each other all day long.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The little playhouse they made for you, have you already played in it (=yours)?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Kunu & Heena played in my new car.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nįį wiiguc wiišgac Kųnųga nąga Heenąga wiirakišgac raje?
Translated_Text: The squirt gun, did you play with it with Kunu & Heena?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧį rušgap kšąįkšu ceekra, hąąpte'e yaakarašgac.
Translated_Text: I played with my new baseball glove today.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Look, the kids are playing with your car.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I played with the marbles.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧį hapa šgaacra, waarucra hakišgac wa'ųnąąkšąną.
Translated_Text: They are playing ping pong on the table.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The toy I bought him, he's playing with it on the table.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Cąąkeja ciinąąkeeja nįį hožunąkra, žee horašgac?
Translated_Text: There was a puddle out in the back of the house, did you play in it?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Biik šgaac wiišgac hižą ceek hakiituwįra, hakarašgacnąkšąną.
Translated_Text: The card game I bought for himself I'm playing with it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąąx hagicira, mąąxra hagišgac wa'ųirera, woogitek hiire.
Translated_Text: They played on the farmer's field and made him mad.
Comment:
mąąxra hįįgišgacire = they played on my field
hanįgiišgacirera = on your field
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Let's go play on the ice!
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧį rušgap šgaacnąąkra, hojį hikiicgairera, nįįkjąk waašįnįra hisge hojį warakaragi?
Translated_Text: They were practicing baseball and hitting, did you have your kids hit some?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧį rušgap šgaacnąkra, hapa hikiicgairera, nįįkjąk waašįnįra hisge hapa warakaragi?
Translated_Text: They were practicing baseball and hitting, did you have your kids hit some?
Comment:
hojį would sound better
wa- not possible on hapa *waapa rakaragi
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hiraati rookeja kikiružicnąąk'ų, nąąižą hapa kįįre.
Translated_Text: They were teasing each other in the car caused themselves to hit a tree.
Comment: hapaire would sound better
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you have your schoolchildren show all their work?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hirukąnąra waagax hagipahara, wiibocacaš wakąja kook yaagipaha waa'ų.
Translated_Text: I showed my boss the papers with a computer.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hokiwagax hahi paahara, wiibocacaš wakąja kook wiipaha waa'ų.
Translated_Text: When I went there to show pictures I used them computer to show them with.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you allow your toys to get broke?
Comment: with CAUS less control than warakaraišiš
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you accidentally break your Kunu's toy?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you put oatmeal in your Kunu's bowl?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you make your kids plant the garden?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nąą xete hižą paacgisra nąiwacgiscekra yaa(kara)k'ų waa'ų.
Translated_Text: When I cut this big tree down I used my new saw.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nąą xete hižą wacgisra nąiwacgiscekra higi'ų wa'ų.
Translated_Text: When he cut this big tree down he used his new saw.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you make your kids make frybread?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąąx hožura s'ii hąke ha'ųnįra, hacągeere hahi ųų hakį.
Translated_Text: I didn't do the planting for a long time and eventually made myself do it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made a paper airplane for myself.
Comment: *hakikarak'ų
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The kids made paper airplanes for each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hiraati hižą pįįš'ųra, hiraati hot'ųpxete hašįnįra, žee ee horakarak'ų waš'ų?
Translated_Text: When you fixed the car, did you do it in your big garage?
Comment: *hok'ų
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wažątire pįįš'ųra wažątire hot'ųp hanįra hoįragiš'ų?
Translated_Text: When fixed the car did you do it in my garage?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you make the frybread in my bowls?
Comment: questionable
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When you were making frybread, did you make it in these bowls?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinįk hiira mąącguserec hižą karagi'ųkjene ee.
Translated_Text: He said he is going to make a longbow for his son.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He said he is going to make a long bow for himself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made this bow for myself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They let me make the frybread.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wažoonį aagi rakįra, šųųkra tookewehi warakaragi?
Translated_Text: When you prepared to go hunting, did you cause your dogs to get hungry?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Šųųk hanįra hąąp taanį hirakara waagigira, tookewehi hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: I let them watch my dog for three days and they caused him to be hungry.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Is his dog hungry? Do you know?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: My cat was really sick, so I killed it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga wookąnąk cųųšgųnį hihinąp rakaragira, taasak rakaragi?
Translated_Text: When you let Kunu go out without a hat on, did you make him feel cold?
Comment: them = taasak warakargi
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga ciinąkeja hanį hahira, hirohąpeja wiišgac hagipaha, že'e roogų hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I took Kunu to town and showed him a toy in the window, and I made him want it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąąnąąpe hokiwagax hixgąxgą wahairera, mąąnąąpe kįį roogų wįįre.
Translated_Text: They showed a military film and they made me want to become a soldier.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Mąąnąąpe hokiwagax hixgąxgą wahairera, hinįk haara, mąąnąąpe kįį roogų hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: They were showing a military film and they made my son want to join the military.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Ciixeteižą hįgi'ųirera, hinįk haara, nįįšge eja cii hakaragi.
Translated_Text: They made a big house for me, I made my son live there also.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Ciinąkra hanįjaregi, ciixųnųįk woogairera, hegų že'e hici wa'ųjee.
Translated_Text: After the town got flooded they gave him a tiny little house, and he's still living with it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hitek raaga howažara, Hinų raaga eeja hahi giciijee?
Translated_Text: When your Teega got ill, your older sister did she go there to keep house for him, stay there?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Ciinąkeja ha'e hiinąąkra, hinųk raaga nąąxgų rakaragi?
Translated_Text: In town they were talking about something, did you make your daughter hear it = did you inform her of it?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When they ran into each other in the dark they scared each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hokawas rookeja nįįpaija mąąnį hahiire, wažąižą hajairera, nąąǧire kįire.
Translated_Text: They walked to the stream in the dark and saw something, they scared themselves (it was their own fault for walking around in the dark).
Comment: kįįkįire = more than once
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Šųųk waroocgųnį hižą nąągueja jeera, Kųnųga nąga Heenąga nąąǧire hii wahaa.
Translated_Text: There was a strange dog in the road and I made Kunu and Heena scare it (away).
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They scared the kid with a toy animal.
Comment: ...wįįre wa'ųire = they scared me...
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They scared my dog.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga wiišgac hižą karaipįxjį nįhera, wook'ų hakaragi.
Translated_Text: My Kunu, the toy he really cherished, I made him give it to them.
Comment:
hašii is preferred
wooga is better
Kųnųga wiišgac hižą karaipįxjį nįhera, wook'ų/wooga hakaragi. / hašii.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Too hagihiwira, Kųnųga pąąra ee rusgic hakaragi.
Translated_Text: We were picking potatoes and I made my Kunu tie his/the bag.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made my self tie it by accident.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The boys were playing cowboys and they tied each other up.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The cat was playing with the string and tied himself up.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They made me put the lodge poles together.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Tie the strips of wood together!
Comment: waakirusgiciraginį = they already tied them together
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made my son sing.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: S/he sang to her child and finally made him sleep.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He's helping him sing with that microphone.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you make your horse run?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Siikąra rukjų hiira, hisųk hiira eecą nųųgiwąkže aire.
Translated_Text: He sprained his ankle so his younger brother ran for him.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: *Giyaasra, cąąkeja wažątire hižą aakra, že'e hinųwąk wa'ų.
Translated_Text: He ran away, by use of that car that was parked out side.
Comment: sounds odd
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you make your dog climb up the stairs here?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waginąra joop hi'ųireanąga nąąxetejeega kiijire hirokikiti wa'ųire.
Translated_Text: Using the four ropes they helped each other climb that big tree.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They climbed that mountain with strong rope.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nįįkjąkįkra hikinų wažąpšopšoc haipšira, hooxi(w)i hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I accidentally put powder to the child and caused him to cough.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made my son wash his/the car.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I already washed myself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Go wash up (all of your body)!
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I washed myself in that water there.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I washed myself in that jar/glass.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He can go wash it over that big flat rock over there.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nąągura nųųwąk hatuce nąą'įwigają, hinįk haara bookewe hakaragi.
Translated_Text: We tried to run across the road and I caused my son to stumble/fall down.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Iinį hižą nąąxjaknąga, neexjį bookewe hakį.
Translated_Text: I kicked the rock and made myself stumble.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinįk haara mąąšją šgaacnąąk'ų, bookewe hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: They caused my son to stumble when they were playing rough.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Caapną hikiisik kikišgaacnąąk'ų hinįk hiira bookikarakewe.
Translated_Text: They were playing lacrosse and he tripped over his son.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They tripped over each other playing lacrosse.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: S/he tripped over his/her shoe.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He tripped into the cave, he had kicked a rock, and that's how he did it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He tripped over the rocks.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hokawas rookeja mąąs nąągura haboakewe waa'ų.
Translated_Text: In the darkness I tripped over the railroad tracks.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wažątirera yaakarakišere haja'ų hikinų wakąjakookra šiipre hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I was working on my car and I accidentally made my car battery fall down.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Xee uukeja mąąnįąk'ų, huu(ra) hinąąkisiknąga, eeja šiipre hakį.
Translated_Text: I was walking along the edge of the hill, I tripped over my feet and caused myself to fall.
Comment: huu hinąsik is a fixed expression
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They shook the trees and made the cherries fall down.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When the apples are ripe on the tree they are letting them fall (they didn't pick them, but they waited).
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They used explosives to make that rock fall.
Comment: sound weird
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: My wallet fell into the water.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Ciieja iinį waxų hajiirera, hicąwį haara xąąwįoxerera hagišipraire.
Translated_Text: That gravel that they came to pour at my house, they fell on my wife's flowers.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hiraatixetera iinį waxųra xąąwįoxerera hašipre wahii.
Translated_Text: The truck that poured/dropped the gravel, he made it fall on the flowers.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The new hat that I had hung up on the wall there, it fell down.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Other tribal people they danced and they said they made it rain.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I rained into my eye.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wanįk hohiraižą cąąkeja hakerera, honįįžugišąną hoixjį wa'ųjee.
Translated_Text: The bird bath I put outside, only when it rains it is full.
Comment:
Wanįk hohiraižą cąąkeja hakerera, honįįžugišąną hoixjį jiije =
the bird bath I put outside, only when it rains it fills up
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinųk haara woowąk gejenį, hiraatira hakocąk haišera, ǧaak hakaragi.
Translated_Text: My daughter was naughty, so I took her car away for a little while and I made her cry.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When they shot my dog, they made me cry.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: When I was little they used to let me cry.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga wakišgac hiira, hikinų hapairera, ǧaak hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: My Kunu went to play with them, and they accidentally hit him and they made him cry.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hįxųnųįk hanįharegi, hišjasuregi, hikinų haakipara, ǧaak hakį.
Translated_Text: When I was little, I accidentally poked myself in the eye, and I caused myself to cry.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga wiipe'įra ho(kara)ǧak mįįkwakšąną; eesge hokohi teegi ke nąąxgų pįįnį.
Translated_Text: Kunu is crying into his pillow (in that other room there), that's why we can't hear him well in this room here.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wiicawak tuuc raara, Hinųga ruuc rakaragi?
Translated_Text: Did you have your Hinu eat that muskrat meat that you cooked?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: S'iireja Kųnųga wažą waagitakra, žige wewį hagigi.
Translated_Text: Something I told my Kunu a long time ago, I made him think about it again.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga waagaxhajahocieja woore hok'ųirera, mąąšją wewį hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: The work they gave my Kunu in school, they made him think hard.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Woorak š'aakižą horakirera, s'ii wewį wįįre.
Translated_Text: They told an old story and they made me think for a long time.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He is thinking of himself, and he is boasting there of himself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They were thinking of each other and boasting of each other (like politicians would do in their speeches).
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Thinking about himself he is telling his personal side of things there.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hi'ųnį hiira waagaxhaja hokiišipra, že'e hiwewįanąga nįįšge waagaxhaja ree.
Translated_Text: Her mother finished school, with that in mind / thinking about that, she also went to school.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wiirokų waanįra, hąke hižą hįgijiranįkjenera, yaaperesra, eesge nee honį hakį.
Translated_Text: The tool I was looking for, no-one was going to help me and I knew it, so I made myself look for it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wiiwagaxceek ruwį roogųirera, nee wooruwį hocieja honį hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: They wanted to buy a new pen, and they made me search for it at the store.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wooreeja wažątire xawanį wahiirera, nee woonį hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: At work they lost cars, and they let me look for them.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hiraaticekra hižą hinįk hiira hogikaranį nįhe.
Translated_Text: He is looking for a new car for his son.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hostoxeteeja hąąpserec hokikinį hanįhaire, kaaga hiki(ki)k'eiranį.
Translated_Text: At the gathering they looked for each other all day, but they never found each other.
Comment: triple checked, -k- is okay
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He went to look for a new car for himself.
Comment: hižą would imply a specific car
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Search for it with a flashlight!
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Search for me!
Comment: look around for me
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Look for my shoes!
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinįk haara hitek hiira ceek kirira, nąąt'ųp hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I made my son hug his Teega, who had just come home.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hitek haara kirira, hąke haipįnįnųnįge, nąąt'ųp wįįre.
Translated_Text: My Teega came back and I didn’t like it, but they made me hug him.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: S'ii ke hacanįra, haišąnąšjįnųnįge nąąt'ųp hakį.
Translated_Text: I hadn't seen him for a long time, and he was dirty, but I made myself hug him anyway.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wažątire hikišerera, aara haišąnąširenųnįge, cųųšge hiira hahi wiinąkarat'ųpjee.
Translated_Text: He worked on the car and his arms were dirty, there he still is hugging his nephew.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wažątire hikišerera, aara haišąnąširenųnįge, hahi ee wiinąt'ųpjee.
Translated_Text: He worked on the car and his arms were dirty, there he is still hugging her with them.
Comment: wa- both arms
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made his (e.g. my son's) head hurt.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hąąheserec nįįnąwox taacgąra, nąąsura teek hakį.
Translated_Text: I drank beer all night long, and I made my head ache.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: ?Waǧįǧį nąąxjak hašgacra nąąsueja hįjinąkirera, nąąsura teek hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: I was playing football and got bumped in the head, they made my head hurt.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They made my Kunu’s head ache.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Huunąąkera nįge hųų(gi)tek waa'ųąkšąną, eesge hinąątepakšąną.
Translated_Text: It's hurting somewhere in my calf, that's why I'm limping.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He pitched last night, now he's saying his arm is hurting.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hicąwį haara wažą waagitakra, horuš'ak hakaragi.
Translated_Text: When I told my wife something, I made her sad.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hąąheserec nąącge woįci hanįhegejenį, horuš'ak hakį.
Translated_Text: Because I was worried all night, I got depressed (/I made myself lonely).
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waagaxhajahocieja wažą nąąxgųra, hinįk haara horuš'ak hįgigiire.
Translated_Text: Something he heard in school, they caused my son to be sad.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I picked berries all day and I'm all tired out.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga cąąkeja wookąnąk cųųšgųnį šgaac hagigira, howža hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I caused my Kunu to get sick, when I let him play outside without a cap on.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: S'ii hąke hanąnįra, haji howaža hakį.
Translated_Text: I didn't sleep for a long time and I made myself sick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nįįkjąkra hooxiwi hanįhairera, nįįšge howaža wįįre.
Translated_Text: When the kids kept coughing, and they also made me sick.
Comment: hįwaxaire = they infected me
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They were looking after my Kunu last night and they made my Kunu sick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wanį t'eek tuuc kįįra, ruucra, že'e hiro(ka)waža wa'ų.
Translated_Text: He cooked himself some rotten meat, he ate it, that's what caused his being sick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga ceewasnį nąąš racgąra, že'e hiro(gi)waža wa'ų.
Translated_Text: My Kunu drank sour milk and he got sick from it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I drank sour milk and I got sick from it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Cąąkeja hįįnįžura, ciieja hagi wuus hakį.
Translated_Text: I was caught in the rain outside, I went home and got myself dried off.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I stretched the hides and finally got them to dry.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The deer hides got so dry they got hardened.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wainį howus hiieja wa'įra wuus hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I dried my blanket in the drier.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They dried his blanket for him in it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wainį howus hii hižą tuuwįwi, eeja wa'įsgįįgrera howuus haa.
Translated_Text: We bought a clothes drier, I dried the heavy blanket in there.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga waagax wiiwaža Heenąga nąąpra wuus wagigi.
Translated_Text: Kunu dried Heena’s hands with a paper towel.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: My hands are dry already.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I hung it outside on the clothesline and it dried right away (wind or weather dried it).
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They painted their faces, looked at each other and laughed at each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He is looking in the mirror and laughing at himself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Your Little Heena was mad about something but did you get him to laugh eventually?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Haaga Mikega ha'e hiirera, hikša wįįre.
Translated_Text: When they talked of Haaga Mike they made me laugh.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They made my Kunu laugh.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nąą gicgis harairera, Kųnųga wagijire hakaragi.
Translated_Text: They went to cut wood, I made my Kunu help them.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga waǧįǧįra girušją reehira ruxe rakaragi?
Translated_Text: Kunu let the ball go, did you make him chase it?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I chased his pig with a stick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I chased the chicken with a stick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: ?Hinųga Gųųšgehonąkeja ciijeera, Kųnųga Teešišikeja hahi hikipa hakaragi.
Translated_Text: Hinu is living in Chicago, I made my Kunu go meet her in Milwaukee.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinįk haara wiišgac ceekra hazohi hagipahagają, gipį hakaragi.
Translated_Text: When I showed the new toy to my son carefully, I made him like it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The girls liked each other, when they were playing with each other outside.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wiišgacįk hižą hagituwįra hagipahagają nąąkewe hakaragi.
Translated_Text: That little toy I bought for him, when I showed it to him, I made him scared of it (his own) / I caused him to be scared.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The dogs are afraid of each other.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hokiwagax hižą wagaxra haakja horoǧoc karagi.
Translated_Text: He made her look at the picture she had drawn.
Comment: the picture that he drew he made him look at it again
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Where did he get this car from?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Where did he get this gun back from (was his before)?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Where do you get this for/from him?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He used his per cap to get a car.
Comment: not a good sentence
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They took it back with a big truck.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They took his tooth out with the big pliers.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Take the pan with this.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He experienced it that way / it happened to him that way.
Comment: heesge harus = it happened to him that way
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They took all my money.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinįk haara hopoxra ee k'ee hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I made my son dig the hole for himself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I let him dig his own hole.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made myself dig that hole.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They let me dig a hole.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made this ditch using a stick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He dug a hole for him with a stick.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I dug a hole for myself in that cave.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They dug a hole for me in the cave.
Comment: only in third person
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Can you dig a hole in the cave for me?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Comment: moopoxeja hok'aire = they dug in the cave
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you dig the hole for yourself?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I dug a hole for myself on that hill.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Did you dig this hole for yourself?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I will dig my hole on top of that hill.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Can you dig a big hole for me?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made myself peel all the apples.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They made me peel the apples.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Peel the oranges into that bowl.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wažątire hižą Kųnųga mąįsįc hiira, haja rakaragi?

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I made him aware of where he was from, where he came from (e.g. talking to one of my clan members).
Comment: sounds like a mean statement
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I will make my son talk to you.
Comment: o.k., if context is established
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Žuura hoginącra že'e ee hahi hiro(gi)kit'e waajee.
Translated_Text: She is talking to him about that money that other person borrowed.
Comment: gi- not necessary
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I taught my dog and I made my dog ask for food.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Heena was naughty and I had him tell it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waǧįǧį rušgap wiirojįižą hanįra ee hirokirak wa'ųjee.

Primary_Text: Woorak hižą hokarakra, hokiwagax xete hirokarak wa'ų.

Primary_Text: Woorak hižą hųųgirakra, hokiwagax xete hiroįgirak wa'ų.
Translated_Text: When he told me a story he used a big picture.

Primary_Text: Wažąižą hanųųxąwą hanįhera, hahi horak hakį.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Kųnųga wanįra hireanąga ceewasnį wikįnįjara ee wamąącgis hakaragi.

Translated_Text: I rubbed soap on my face.
Comment: yaakawaža = wipe off
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wajera ciiropeja haistak haara, rugas hakaragi.
Translated_Text: My dress got stuck in the door and I made it tear.

Primary_Text: Heenąga hinįk hiira wažątire šuucra ee hawają karagi.

Primary_Text: S'ii waapera, wažątire šuucra neexjį iineki hawają hakį.
Translated_Text: I waited for them for a long time, but then I decided to push the red car myself.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They let me push the red car.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I pushed myself along and I got there.
Comment: like in a wheelchair
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hiraati gišiš haara, wažątire hot'ųpeja iineki waakawają.

Translated_Text: I used that long stick and pushed myself in the boat.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Xąąwį howaporokra hanąąc mąąx hagici wažątire wiirakawająire.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Xąąwį howaporokra hanąąc mąąx hagici wažątire wiiragiwająire.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Xąąwį howaporokra hanąąc mąąx hagici wažątire wiirawająire.
Translated_Text: They pushed the bails of hay with a farm vehicle.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Nįge mąąx hožura hikinų howagisxete hagiwanąną.

Translated_Text: He rolled his tire here/ he came here rolling his tire.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He rolled a bottle on top of the table.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He rolled the ball for me.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hinįk haara šųųkra ee gigųs hakaragi.
Translated_Text: I made/had my son teach his dog.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He teaches in that garage.
Comment: sounds weird
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waagax hakiruxara ceek hižą waak'ųra nįįkjąkra wiikaragigųsšąną.
Translated_Text: The new book I gave him he taught his children with it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waagax hakiruxara ceek hižą waak'ųra žee ee higigųsšąną.
Translated_Text: The new book I gave him he taught with it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They made me teach the children/ I took over to teaching the kids.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He was teasing his cat and made his cat holler.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The kid screamed into the cave.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Screaming with a loudspeaker, they all heard him.
Comment: sounds a bit weird
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Why are you screaming at me?
Comment: the first 2.A. is odd, also the nasal spread to the left, but this is the correct version (triple checked!)
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Šųųkjąkhižą hikipa, nąąǧire hii nąą'įanąga, ii(gi)janįkšąną.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Comment: kįkįire - every now and then
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: You can cook them in the kettle.
Comment: not with -ra, only with -eja
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: You can cook them in this kettle.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: They made me cook the potatoes.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I cooked coffee with a can, using a can.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Eeja hąąpra taakacgi, iinįeja wanįkiicge hatuc hii pįį wa'ųnąąkšąną.
Translated_Text: There when the day is hot, you can cook eggs on the rocks.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: I sank my boat.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: My boat sank.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Hąke hirakara ha'ųnįgi, neexjį xere hakįkjene.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He boiled his own water.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: You can boil the water with the pail.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: My water is boiling.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He told his son that he got mad.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Waagaxhaja hocieja hošgac hanįhairera, eeja t'ee kįį hiire.
Translated_Text: They bullied him in school and they made him commit suicide.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Wijuk ee hanįra howažaxjįra t'ee karagi hii.
Translated_Text: His cat was real sick and he made him kill it.
Comment: hii not necessary
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The cat was real sick and they made me kill it.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The battle on the island a lot of them killed each other.
Comment:
kįikįire = here and there they killed each other, nįgešąną
kįįre sounds more like they committed suicide
t'ee kįį hiire - they made him kill himself
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Caa hižą guucra, t'ee hii hįgigi.

Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Can you kill my cat?
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: Even though I was afraid I made myself touch the snake.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: The teacher made me touch the snake.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Translated_Text: He accidentally touched his fire/stove.
Example_Type: offered by speaker & checked w/ other speaker(s)

Primary_Text: Toikewehixjį gejenį ciinąkeja kšeeižą mąąnų hakį.

Translated_Text: It's hard to say.
Comment: A lexicalised combination, meaning roughly 'hard to know'.

Translated_Text: He was touching himself.
Comment: This is a distinct "sexual" meaning of touch. It occurs not only with the reflexive, but also in reciprocal contexts (e.g. they were touching each other) and in the regular transitive frame, with a vaguer but still sex-related meaning (e.g. If you ever touch her again, I'll kill you).

Primary_Text: The flames were so high they were touching the roof.

Primary_Text: Their feet were touching under the table.
Translated_Text: Their feet were touching under the table.

Primary_Text: They'd left for the coast a few days earlier.
Translated_Text: They'd left for the coast a few days earlier.

Primary_Text: I tore her photo out of a magazine.
Translated_Text: I tore her photo out of a magazine.
Comment: Can be viewed as variant of tear from.

Translated_Text: I think the library's open.
Comment: Though this is often regarded as a that-complement construction with the complement deleted, there is literature that argues that I think is better analysed as an epistemic formula.

Primary_Text: I thought to myself, "What am I going to do now?".
Translated_Text: I thought to myself, "What am I going to do now?".
Comment: This is a quotative kind of structure, but it includes a "quasi-addressee" PP with a reflexive pronoun.

Primary_Text: I thought of him as a kindred spirit.
Translated_Text: I thought of him as a kindred spirit.

Primary_Text: I think very highly of him.
Translated_Text: I think very highly of him.
Comment: There must be an evaluative complement, explicit or implied. A sentence like What do you think of him?, for example, is seeking an evaluation.

Primary_Text: When the job was mentioned, straight away I thought of you.
Translated_Text: When the job was mentioned, straight away I thought of you.

Primary_Text: I thought of going to the police.
Translated_Text: I thought of going to the police.

Primary_Text: I was thinking of buying a MacBook Pro.
Translated_Text: I was thinking of buying a MacBook Pro.
Comment: This appears to be a specialised complement structure.

Primary_Text: She likes to go for long walks by the seaside.
Translated_Text: She likes to go for long walks by the seaside.

Primary_Text: Those who can't swim generally sink like a stone.
Translated_Text: Those who can't swim generally sink like a stone.

Primary_Text: The Titanic sank in the Atlantic Ocean.
Translated_Text: The Titanic sank in the Atlantic Ocean.

Primary_Text: The poor boy lost his grip and sank under the waves.
Translated_Text: The poor boy lost his grip and sank under the waves.
It sank into the swamp.

Primary_Text: The Angel Gabriel appeared to Mary.
Translated_Text: The Angel Gabriel appeared to Mary.
Comment: The PP to someone could perhaps be regarded as a variant of the expected locus expression, but I suspect that it really deserves to be recognised an a specialised alternation of appear. Especially when we consider an expression like appeared to her in a dream, it is clear that the person specified in the PP is not merely a "location" but a "see-er", i.e. in an Experience role.

Primary_Text: They played me for a fool.
Translated_Text: They played me for a fool.
Comment: A distinct polysemic meaning, associated with this highly specific lexico-grammatical frame (to play someone for a fool).

Primary_Text: He took her to the doctor.
Translated_Text: He took her to the doctor.
Take me to your leader.
Comment: I suspect that when the verb occurs with a human direct object it represents a distinct polysemic meaning.

Primary_Text: They cut at his attacker's throat.
Translated_Text: They cut at his attacker's throat.
Comment: Most naturally occurring examples of Conative with cut seem to be in the context of someone wielding a sword or a knife.

Primary_Text: At the time it was bad, but we laughed about it later.
Translated_Text: At the time it was bad, but we laughed about it later.

Primary_Text: It was her birthday party and she was dressed up as a fairy.
Translated_Text: It was her birthday party and she was dressed up as a fairy.

Primary_Text: He was dressed as a schoolboy.
Translated_Text: He was dressed as a schoolboy.

Primary_Text: John sent Bill to get newspapers from the store.
Translated_Text: John sent Bill to get newspapers from the store.
Comment: With a human direct object, this is a distinct meaning from 'sending something', because it does not involve transfer of possession. It does not imply that the person who was sent arrived at the intended destination or achieved the intended goal.

Translated_Text: She sent him away.

Primary_Text: He expected me to just give and give and get nothing in return.
Translated_Text: He expected me to just give and give and get nothing in return.
Comment: A distinct and more abstract meaning than the primary meaning of give, involving change of possession.

Translated_Text: The fire was burning brightly.
He climbed the fence.
Comment: This is a "covert valency" alternation, because (i) it is a near paraphase of climbed over the fence, unlike as of climbed the ladder, mountain, etc. (ii) semantically the NP denotes an obstacle (e.g. fence, gate, wall): the construction implies going from one side of this obstacle to the other, (iii) the same construction is found with verbs like swim and jump (e.g. swim the river, jump the puddle), but with these verbs it is more obvious because they are normally intransitive.

Translated_Text: They asked me to resign.

Primary_Text: I had a long talk with her about it.
Translated_Text: I had a long talk with her about it.

Primary_Text: I can't talk to her. She won't listen.
Translated_Text: I can't talk to her. She won't listen.

Primary_Text: They were talking in a whisper.
Translated_Text: They were talking in a whisper.

Primary_Text: It rained on my new car yesterday.
Translated_Text: It rained on my new car yesterday.

Primary_Text: It rained on my wedding day.
Translated_Text: It rained on my wedding day.
They are talking in Spanish.
They are talking Spanish.
They were talking linguistics.
Comment: Here the complement represents the topic being talked about.

Translated_Text: Don't talk nonsense.
He's always following me around.

Primary_Text: His eyes followed her every move.
Translated_Text: His eyes followed her every move.
